{"step_by_step_thinking": "Taxilin is a protein that has been studied in various contexts, but it is not typically recognized as a cancer marker. Cancer markers are substances, often proteins, that are produced by the body in response to cancer growth. They are typically substances that are released into the bloodstream or other body fluids and can be measured.
